selected_quotes: When people decide to stop eating and drinking towards the end of life...important paper #hpm
Voluntary stopping of eating drinking at end of life - insight into option of hastening death in capacitated adults
Eating drinking at the end of life. Interesting read #hpm #hospice
Voluntary stopping of eating and drinking: an option to hasten death in adults at the end of life?

citation.abstract: The terminally ill person's autonomy and control are important in preserving the quality of life in situations of unbearable suffering. Voluntary stopping of eating and drinking (VSED) at the end of life has been discussed over the past 20 years as one possibility of hastening death. This article presents a 'systematic search and review' of published literature concerned with VSED as an option of hastening death at the end of life by adults with decision-making capacity.
citation.title: Voluntary stopping of eating and drinking at the end of life - a 'systematic search and review' giving insight into an option of hastening death in capacitated adults at the end of life

news.title: Despite advance directive, dementia patient denied her last wish, says spouse
news.summary: Bill Harris visits his wife, Nora, at the Fern Gardens memory care center in Medford, Ore.

news.title: Despite advance directive, Oregon dementia patient denied last wish, says spouse
news.summary: Nora Harris, 64, a former librarian, signed an advance directive after her diagnosis to prevent her life from being prolonged when her disease got worse.

news.title: Dementia patient denied her last wish, says spouse
news.summary: The 75-year-old retired tech worker says it’s his duty to Nora Harris, his spouse of nearly four decades, who was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer’s disease in 2009.

news.title: Dementia patient was denied last wish, spouse says

news.title: Despite Advance Directive, Dementia Patient Denied Last Wish, Says Spouse
